conditions.name: Common Cold
conditions.recommendation: Rest, stay hydrated, and use over-the-counter medications to manage symptoms. Consult a doctor if symptoms persist or worsen.

conditions.name: Influenza (Flu)
conditions.recommendation: Get plenty of rest and fluids. Antiviral drugs may be prescribed by a doctor. Seek medical attention if you have difficulty breathing.

conditions.name: Pneumonia
conditions.recommendation: Pneumonia can be serious. It is crucial to see a doctor for diagnosis and likely treatment with antibiotics. Rest and hydration are also important.

conditions.name: Asthma
conditions.recommendation: Use prescribed inhalers as directed. Identify and avoid triggers. Consult a doctor for a long-term management plan.

conditions.name: Migraine

specific_symptoms.name: throbbing one-sided pain
aliases: pulsating pain on one side of my head

conditions.recommendation: Rest in a dark, quiet room. Use over-the-counter or prescribed pain relievers. Consult a doctor for diagnosis and management.

conditions.name: Gastroenteritis (Stomach Flu)
conditions.recommendation: Stay hydrated with clear fluids (BRAT diet). Rest is important. See a doctor if you can't keep liquids down or if symptoms are severe.

conditions.name: COVID-19
conditions.recommendation: Isolate to prevent spread. Monitor symptoms. Rest and stay hydrated. Seek immediate medical care for breathing difficulties.

conditions.name: Diabetes Type 2
conditions.recommendation: Consult a doctor for diagnosis and management, which may include lifestyle changes, diet, and medication.

conditions.name: Hypertension (High Blood Pressure)
conditions.recommendation: Often has no symptoms. Regular check-ups are key. Management involves lifestyle changes and prescribed medication. Consult a doctor.

conditions.name: Myocardial Infarction (Heart Attack)

specific_symptoms.name: pain radiating to left arm or jaw
feeling of impending doom
aliases: feel like I'm going to die

conditions.recommendation: This is a medical emergency. Call emergency services immediately.

conditions.name: Stroke

specific_symptoms.name: sudden weakness on one side
aliases: one side of body is weak

conditions.recommendation: This is a medical emergency. Call emergency services immediately. Time is critical.

conditions.name: Anemia
conditions.recommendation: Consult a doctor for diagnosis to determine the cause and appropriate treatment, often involving iron supplements.

conditions.name: Urinary Tract Infection (UTI)
conditions.recommendation: See a doctor for diagnosis and likely antibiotic treatment. Drink plenty of water.

conditions.name: Kidney Stones

specific_symptoms.name: severe pain in side and back

conditions.recommendation: Drink plenty of water to help pass small stones. A doctor may prescribe pain medication or recommend a procedure for larger stones.

conditions.name: Allergic Rhinitis (Hay Fever)
conditions.recommendation: Avoid allergens. Use over-the-counter antihistamines or nasal sprays. Consult a doctor for persistent symptoms.

conditions.name: Eczema (Atopic Dermatitis)
conditions.recommendation: Moisturize skin regularly. Avoid triggers and harsh soaps. A doctor can prescribe medicated creams.

conditions.name: Psoriasis

specific_symptoms.name: red patches of skin covered with thick, silvery scales

conditions.recommendation: Consult a dermatologist for a treatment plan, which may include topical treatments, light therapy, or medications.

conditions.name: Depression
conditions.recommendation: It is important to seek help from a mental health professional. Therapy and medication can be very effective. Talk to someone you trust.

conditions.name: Anxiety Disorder
conditions.recommendation: Therapy, such as cognitive-behavioral therapy (CBT), and medication can help. Consult a mental health professional.

conditions.name: Hypothyroidism
conditions.recommendation: Consult a doctor for a blood test and diagnosis. Treatment typically involves daily hormone medication.

conditions.name: Hyperthyroidism
conditions.recommendation: Consult a doctor for diagnosis and a treatment plan, which may include medication or other therapies.

conditions.name: Tuberculosis
conditions.recommendation: Tuberculosis is a serious infectious disease. Immediate medical consultation for diagnosis and a long course of antibiotics is required.

conditions.name: Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease (COPD)
conditions.recommendation: Quitting smoking is essential. A doctor can prescribe inhalers and other treatments to manage symptoms. Consult a pulmonologist.

conditions.name: Tension Headache

specific_symptoms.name: band-like pressure around the head
aliases: head feels like it's in a vise

conditions.recommendation: Over-the-counter pain relievers, stress management, and rest can help. Consult a doctor for chronic tension headaches.

conditions.name: Diabetes Type 1
conditions.recommendation: Requires lifelong insulin therapy and blood sugar monitoring. Consult an endocrinologist for comprehensive management.

conditions.name: Appendicitis

specific_symptoms.name: pain starting near the navel and moving to the lower right abdomen
rebound tenderness
aliases: hurts more when I let go

conditions.recommendation: This is a medical emergency that usually requires surgery. Seek immediate medical attention.

conditions.name: Irritable Bowel Syndrome (IBS)

specific_symptoms.name: changes in bowel habits (diarrhea or constipation)

conditions.recommendation: Management involves dietary changes, stress management, and sometimes medication. Consult a gastroenterologist.

conditions.name: Crohn's Disease
conditions.recommendation: This is a type of IBD requiring long-term management by a specialist. Treatment aims to reduce inflammation. Consult a gastroenterologist.

conditions.name: Rheumatoid Arthritis

specific_symptoms.name: joint stiffness that is worse in the mornings

conditions.recommendation: Early diagnosis and treatment are key to prevent joint damage. Consult a rheumatologist for management.

conditions.name: Osteoarthritis
conditions.recommendation: Management includes exercise, weight management, physical therapy, and pain relievers. Consult a doctor.

conditions.name: Gout

specific_symptoms.name: sudden, severe attacks of pain, typically in the big toe

conditions.recommendation: Dietary changes and medication can help manage gout. Consult a doctor for diagnosis and treatment.

conditions.name: Lupus
conditions.recommendation: Lupus is a complex autoimmune disease requiring specialist care. Consult a rheumatologist for diagnosis and management.

conditions.name: Multiple Sclerosis (MS)
conditions.recommendation: MS is a chronic condition of the central nervous system. Consult a neurologist for diagnosis and a comprehensive management plan.

conditions.name: Parkinson's Disease
conditions.recommendation: A progressive neurological disorder. Consult a neurologist for diagnosis and management with medication and therapy.

conditions.name: Alzheimer's Disease
conditions.recommendation: A progressive brain disorder. Early diagnosis is important. Consult a neurologist for management and support resources.

conditions.name: Bipolar Disorder
conditions.recommendation: A mental health condition requiring long-term management, usually with therapy and medication. Consult a psychiatrist.

conditions.name: Schizophrenia
risk_factors: mind-altering drug use during teen years
conditions.recommendation: A serious mental disorder requiring lifelong treatment with medication and psychosocial therapy. Consult a psychiatrist.

conditions.name: Endometriosis
conditions.recommendation: Consult a gynecologist for diagnosis and a management plan, which may include pain medication or hormonal therapy.

conditions.name: Polycystic Ovary Syndrome (PCOS)
conditions.recommendation: Management focuses on lifestyle changes and medication. Consult a gynecologist or endocrinologist.

conditions.name: Celiac Disease
conditions.recommendation: An immune reaction to eating gluten. A strict gluten-free diet is the only treatment. Consult a gastroenterologist for diagnosis.

conditions.name: Gallstones

specific_symptoms.name: sudden and rapidly intensifying pain in the upper right abdomen

conditions.recommendation: May require surgery to remove the gallbladder. Consult a doctor if you experience sudden, severe abdominal pain.

conditions.name: GERD (Gastroesophageal Reflux Disease)
conditions.recommendation: Lifestyle changes, dietary modification, and over-the-counter or prescription medications can help. Consult a doctor.

conditions.name: Hepatitis B
conditions.recommendation: A serious liver infection. A vaccine is available for prevention. Consult a doctor for diagnosis and treatment.

conditions.name: HIV/AIDS
conditions.recommendation: Requires lifelong antiretroviral therapy (ART). Early diagnosis and treatment are crucial. Seek testing and care from a healthcare provider.

conditions.name: Malaria

specific_symptoms.name: cycles of chills, fever, and sweating

conditions.recommendation: A mosquito-borne infectious disease. Requires prompt diagnosis and treatment with antimalarial drugs. Consult a doctor, especially after travel to endemic areas.

conditions.name: Dengue Fever
conditions.recommendation: A mosquito-borne viral infection. Rest and fluid intake are important. Seek medical care for monitoring, as severe dengue can be life-threatening.

conditions.name: Zika Virus
conditions.recommendation: Usually mild, but can cause birth defects if contracted during pregnancy. Rest and fluids are recommended. Consult a doctor.

conditions.name: Chickenpox
conditions.recommendation: Highly contagious. Vaccination is key for prevention. Treatment is supportive. Keep the patient isolated and consult a doctor.

conditions.name: Shingles

specific_symptoms.name: painful rash that appears as a single stripe of blisters

conditions.recommendation: Caused by the same virus as chickenpox. Early treatment with antiviral medication is important. A vaccine is available for older adults. Consult a doctor.

conditions.name: Mononucleosis (Mono)

specific_symptoms.name: swollen lymph nodes in neck and armpits

conditions.recommendation: Known as 'the kissing disease'. Rest is the primary treatment. Avoid contact sports due to risk of spleen rupture. Consult a doctor.

conditions.name: Strep Throat

specific_symptoms.name: tiny red spots on the roof of the mouth

conditions.recommendation: A bacterial infection that requires antibiotics. See a doctor for a rapid strep test and diagnosis.

conditions.name: Bronchitis
conditions.recommendation: Usually caused by a virus. Rest, fluids, and a humidifier can help. Antibiotics are not typically needed. Consult a doctor if cough persists.

conditions.name: Sinusitis

specific_symptoms.name: pain, tenderness and swelling around eyes, cheeks, nose or forehead

conditions.recommendation: Nasal sprays, decongestants, and pain relievers can help. Consult a doctor if symptoms are severe or persist.

conditions.name: Otitis Media (Ear Infection)
conditions.recommendation: Common in children. A doctor may prescribe antibiotics or recommend observation. Pain medication can help.

conditions.name: Conjunctivitis (Pink Eye)

specific_symptoms.name: gritty feeling in one or both eyes

conditions.recommendation: Can be viral, bacterial, or allergic. Good hygiene is important. See a doctor for diagnosis and appropriate treatment (e.g., antibiotic eye drops).

conditions.name: Lyme Disease
conditions.recommendation: A tick-borne illness. Early antibiotic treatment is key. Consult a doctor if you have been bitten by a tick or have symptoms.

conditions.name: West Nile Virus
conditions.recommendation: A mosquito-borne virus. Most people have no symptoms. Treatment is supportive. Seek medical care for severe symptoms like high fever or confusion.

conditions.name: Food Poisoning
conditions.recommendation: Usually resolves on its own. The main goal is to prevent dehydration by drinking fluids. Seek medical care if symptoms are severe or persistent.

conditions.name: Constipation
conditions.recommendation: Increase fiber and fluid intake. Regular exercise can help. Over-the-counter laxatives may be used short-term. Consult a doctor for chronic issues.

conditions.name: Hemorrhoids
conditions.recommendation: High-fiber diet, fluids, and over-the-counter creams can help. Consult a doctor for persistent or painful hemorrhoids.

conditions.name: Scabies

specific_symptoms.name: itching that is worse at night

conditions.recommendation: Caused by tiny mites. Requires prescription medication to treat. Wash all bedding and clothing. Consult a doctor.

conditions.name: Ringworm
risk_factors: contact with infected person or animal
conditions.recommendation: A fungal infection. Over-the-counter antifungal creams are usually effective. Consult a doctor if it doesn't improve.

conditions.name: Athlete's Foot

specific_symptoms.name: scaly rash that causes itching, stinging, and burning between the toes

conditions.recommendation: A fungal infection. Keep feet clean and dry. Use over-the-counter antifungal powders or creams. Consult a doctor if severe.

conditions.name: Impetigo

specific_symptoms.name: red sores that quickly rupture, ooze for a few days and then form a yellowish-brown crust

conditions.recommendation: A highly contagious bacterial skin infection, common in children. Requires prescription antibiotic ointment or pills. See a doctor.

conditions.name: Cellulitis

specific_symptoms.name: red, swollen skin that feels hot and tender to the touch

conditions.recommendation: A potentially serious bacterial skin infection. Requires prompt treatment with antibiotics. Consult a doctor immediately.

conditions.name: Acne
conditions.recommendation: Good skin hygiene and over-the-counter products can help. A dermatologist can provide more effective treatments for persistent acne.

conditions.name: Rosacea
conditions.recommendation: A chronic skin condition. Identifying and avoiding triggers is key. A dermatologist can prescribe treatments to manage symptoms.

conditions.name: Melanoma

specific_symptoms.name: diameter larger than a pencil eraser

conditions.recommendation: The most serious type of skin cancer. Early detection is critical. Perform regular skin checks and see a dermatologist for any suspicious moles.

conditions.name: Basal Cell Carcinoma

specific_symptoms.name: flat, flesh-colored or brown scar-like lesion

conditions.recommendation: A common, slow-growing skin cancer. Usually not life-threatening but needs treatment. Consult a dermatologist.

conditions.name: Squamous Cell Carcinoma

specific_symptoms.name: flat lesion with a scaly, crusted surface

conditions.recommendation: A common type of skin cancer. Needs treatment. Consult a dermatologist.

conditions.name: Lung Cancer
conditions.recommendation: A leading cause of cancer deaths. Quitting smoking is the best prevention. Consult a doctor for any persistent respiratory symptoms.

conditions.name: Breast Cancer

specific_symptoms.name: change in the size, shape or appearance of a breast

conditions.recommendation: Early detection through self-exams and mammograms is key. Consult a doctor for any breast changes.

conditions.name: Colorectal Cancer
conditions.recommendation: Regular screenings, like colonoscopies, are vital for early detection. Consult a doctor about your screening schedule.

conditions.name: Prostate Cancer
conditions.recommendation: Often slow-growing. Consult a doctor about the pros and cons of screening (e.g., PSA test).

conditions.name: Leukemia
conditions.recommendation: Cancer of the blood-forming tissues. Requires specialist care. Consult a hematologist-oncologist.

conditions.name: Lymphoma

specific_symptoms.name: painless swelling of lymph nodes in neck, armpits or groin

conditions.recommendation: Cancer of the lymphatic system. Consult a hematologist-oncologist for diagnosis and treatment.

conditions.name: Sleep Apnea

specific_symptoms.name: episodes in which you stop breathing during sleep
abrupt awakenings accompanied by shortness of breath

conditions.recommendation: A potentially serious sleep disorder. A sleep study may be needed for diagnosis. Consult a doctor.

conditions.name: Insomnia

specific_symptoms.name: not feeling well-rested after a night's sleep

conditions.recommendation: Practice good sleep hygiene. Cognitive behavioral therapy for insomnia (CBT-I) is effective. Consult a doctor for persistent issues.

conditions.name: Restless Legs Syndrome

specific_symptoms.name: an irresistible urge to move your legs, particularly at night
aliases: have to move legs at night

specific_symptoms.name: symptoms worsen during periods of rest

conditions.recommendation: Lifestyle changes and medication can help manage symptoms. Consult a doctor for diagnosis.

conditions.name: Fibromyalgia

specific_symptoms.name: tenderness to touch in specific areas

conditions.recommendation: A complex chronic pain disorder. Management involves medication, exercise, and stress management. Consult a doctor.

conditions.name: Chronic Fatigue Syndrome

specific_symptoms.name: post-exertional malaise (symptoms worsen after physical or mental effort)

conditions.recommendation: A complex disorder with no single treatment. Management focuses on symptom relief. Consult a doctor.

conditions.name: Carpal Tunnel Syndrome

specific_symptoms.name: numbness or tingling in the hand and arm, particularly the thumb and index, middle or ring fingers

conditions.recommendation: Caused by a pinched nerve in the wrist. Wrist splinting and activity modification can help. Consult a doctor.

conditions.name: Plantar Fasciitis

specific_symptoms.name: stabbing pain in the bottom of your foot near the heel
pain that is usually worst with the first steps in the morning

risk_factors: jobs that keep you on your feet
conditions.recommendation: Stretching exercises, supportive shoes, and rest can help. Consult a doctor or physical therapist.

conditions.name: Tinnitus

specific_symptoms.name: perception of noise or ringing in the ears when no external sound is present

conditions.recommendation: Often a symptom of an underlying condition. Management can include sound therapy and addressing the root cause. Consult a doctor or audiologist.

conditions.name: Vertigo

specific_symptoms.name: a sense that you or your surroundings are spinning or moving

conditions.recommendation: Can have various causes. Certain physical maneuvers can help some types. Consult a doctor for diagnosis.

conditions.name: Meniere's Disease

specific_symptoms.name: a feeling of fullness in the ear

conditions.recommendation: A disorder of the inner ear. Management involves medication and dietary changes. Consult a specialist (ENT).

conditions.name: Cataracts
conditions.recommendation: Clouding of the lens of the eye. Surgery is a very effective treatment. Consult an ophthalmologist.

conditions.name: Glaucoma

specific_symptoms.name: patchy blind spots in your side (peripheral) or central vision

conditions.recommendation: A group of eye conditions that damage the optic nerve. Often has no early symptoms. Regular eye exams are critical for early detection. Consult an ophthalmologist.

conditions.name: Macular Degeneration

specific_symptoms.name: visual distortions, such as straight lines seeming bent

conditions.recommendation: A leading cause of vision loss in older adults. Regular eye exams are important. Consult an ophthalmologist.

conditions.name: Benign Prostatic Hyperplasia (BPH)

specific_symptoms.name: inability to completely empty the bladder
increased frequency of urination at night

conditions.recommendation: An age-related enlargement of the prostate gland. Medication or surgery can help. Consult a urologist.

conditions.name: Pelvic Inflammatory Disease (PID)

specific_symptoms.name: pain in your lower abdomen and pelvis
heavy vaginal discharge with an unpleasant odor

conditions.recommendation: An infection of the female reproductive organs. Requires prompt antibiotic treatment to prevent complications. Consult a doctor.

conditions.name: Human Papillomavirus (HPV) Infection

specific_symptoms.name: small, flesh-colored or gray swellings in your genital area

conditions.recommendation: A very common STI. Often has no symptoms but can cause cancer. A vaccine is highly effective for prevention. Consult a doctor about vaccination and screening.

conditions.name: Herpes Simplex Virus (HSV)

common_symptoms.name: tingling or itching before sores appear

specific_symptoms.name: painful sores or blisters on the mouth (cold sores) or genitals

conditions.recommendation: A common viral infection. There is no cure, but antiviral medication can manage outbreaks. Consult a doctor.

conditions.name: Panic Disorder
conditions.recommendation: Therapy (especially CBT) and medication are effective treatments. Consult a mental health professional.

conditions.name: Obsessive-Compulsive Disorder (OCD)

specific_symptoms.name: repetitive behaviors (compulsions) performed to reduce anxiety

conditions.recommendation: A type of therapy called Exposure and Response Prevention (ERP) and medication can be effective. Consult a mental health professional.

conditions.name: Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD)

specific_symptoms.name: intrusive memories of a traumatic event
avoidance of reminders of the event

conditions.recommendation: Trauma-focused therapies are very effective. Consult a mental health professional specializing in trauma.
